avalancheActivity.comment: Only at very high altitudes is there occasional problematic persistent weak layer on the shady slope and in very steep, extreme terrain. Be aware of the risk of falling.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Ski touring opportunities are and will remain generally limited!

snowpackStructure.comment: Even at higher altitudes there is very little snow, below that it is often bare or there is some snow from last Wednesday. The old snowpack is mostly hard-frozen or icy. When the sun shines, the surface will soften a little during the day depending on the aspect.

tendency.highlights: No change in the weather and no snowfall is expected in the coming days. There is therefore no significant change in the snow and avalanche situation.

weatherForecast.comment:
On Saturday, the sun will continue to shine on the mountains with good visibility and hardly any wind. It will be relatively mild, with temperatures of around 6 degrees at 1500 metres and 4 degrees at 2000 metres.
Sunday will often bring bright sunshine on the mountains and thus the best visibility. A moderate to brisk north-westerly wind will blow. At 1500 metres around -2 degrees, at 2000 metres around -4 degrees.
On Monday, the sun will mostly shine all day. There will be little early morning fog, which will clear quickly. With a brisk westerly wind, temperatures will change little, highs: minus 1 to plus 5 degrees.

ALBINA.generalHeadline: Still very little snow - only in the higher elevations is there a closed snow cover, snowpack at all. This information also applies to the coming days!
